column4: open your browser, go to:  http://localhost:631/ to configure your printer

perhaps it's not installed

cheers
Whats been happening up til now is that I can print a few sheets black and then color all OK. When I ask for photo quality paper and photo quality this is when the trouble starts????
it depends what program you're printing from... different programs can sometimes use a different method of formatting text and images

well, what program(s) are you trying to print from currently?
I am using Ubuntu 8.10 desktop edition is that what you mean?
no... what did you try printing before?
Sorry . I was just printing some photos
using what program? the gimp? firefox? paint? ?
now my Printer configuration has blocked and I cant do turn it off
I think it was Gnome. I just clicked on the photo and then file, print etc.,
can you try to do it again? instead of file->print, how about help->about
OK I will try again and see what happens. Hope the system doesnt go down again. See you later!!!
good luck
